channel.title: Keep item NO matter what on death like firecape? but it isnt working why? error!
channel.description:
ok well u kno on all delta based servers, that on death u keep a firecape even if u are skulled and not item protcedting. well im trying to do this with some other items such as d claws. so i search 6570(fcape id) and i copy the code and replace the IDS. but i get this error.
NOTE: it works fine for firecape but same like of code with diff ID gives error?!?!?!
[IMG]http://i600.photobucket.com/albums/tt81/omgmike1/sss.jpg[/img]

item.title: Keep item NO matter what on death like firecape? but it isnt working why? error!

item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Michaelmmm, post:18, topic:282707”]really? alright tell me exactly how i would do that?

“Please”[/quote]

if(player.hasItem(int)) { addItem(int, 1); }

Ohhh ok i got mixed up I forgot that your supossed to have the delete item thier mybad

If your a “1sttimecoder” Then don’t even bother posting. Your going to make yourself look stupid. And give anothers a good laugh.

im sorta a new coder any chance u could tell me where to put that public boolean and also have 6570 in it or 8002?? or does it depend on the item i neeD?

Put it under

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {	[/code]
so it looks like
[code]public class client extends Player implements Runnable {	
public boolean keep8002 = false;

[/quote]

Dont you need the bracket?[/quote]

item.title: Keep item NO matter what on death like firecape? but it isnt working why? error!
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

xx qwertyuiop xx:

Declare the variable.

keepitem6570 is a BOOLEAN.
You can’t make a void true or false.
Just declare

public boolean keep8002 = false;
should fix the problem.

[quote=“1stimeCoder, post:5, topic:282707”]Lol maybe its giving you an error because it says if(playerHasItem(8002)){
keep8002 = true;
deleteItem(8002, 1);
}

Maybe its the delete item part. Because you want to keep Item 8002 but at the same time you are deleting it.[/quote]
Holy shit your an idiot.

Read full topic

Lol maybe its giving you an error because it says if(playerHasItem(8002)){
keep8002 = true;
deleteItem(8002, 1);
}

Maybe its the delete item part. Because you want to keep Item 8002 but at the same time you are deleting it.
